infodynamics.measures.discrete

Class EntropyCalculatorDiscrete

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.discrete.InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
      • infodynamics.measures.discrete.EntropyCalculatorDiscrete
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SingleAgentMeasureDiscrete
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlockEntropyCalculatorDiscrete

    public class EntropyCalculatorDiscrete
extends InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
implements SingleAgentMeasureDiscrete

    Entropy calculator for univariate discrete (int[]) data.

    Usage of the class is intended to follow this paradigm:

    1. Construct the calculator: EntropyCalculatorDiscrete(int);
    2. Initialise the calculator using initialise();
    3. Provide the observations/samples for the calculator to set up the PDFs, using one or more calls to sets of addObservations(int[]) methods, then
    4. Compute the required quantities, being one or more of:
      • the average entropy: computeAverageLocalOfObservations();
      • local entropy values, such as computeLocal(int[]);
      • and variants of these.
    5. As an alternative to steps 3 and 4, the user may undertake standalone computation from a single set of observations, via e.g.: computeLocal(int[]), computeAverageLocal(int[]) etc.
    6. Return to step 2 to re-use the calculator on a new data set.

    References:

    • T. M. Cover and J. A. Thomas, 'Elements of Information Theory' (John Wiley & Sons, New York, 1991).
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

      • newInstance

        public static EntropyCalculatorDiscrete newInstance(int base,
                                    int blocksize)
        Deprecated. 
        User was formerly forced to create new instances through this factory method. Retained for backwards compatibility.
        Parameters:
        base - number of symbols for each variable. E.g. binary variables are in base-2.
        blocksize - number of consecutive joint values to include in the calculation.
        Returns:
        a new EntropyCalculator

      • computeLocal

        public final double[] computeLocal(int[][] states,
                    int col)
        Description copied from interface: SingleAgentMeasureDiscrete
        Standalone routine to compute local information theoretic measure for one variable in a 2D spatiotemporal multivariate array. Return a time-series array of local values. First history rows are zeros when the measure must build up embedded history of the variable. This method should be used for heterogeneous agents
